section.title: Description
section.p: The language communication capabilities for a Person.

stentry.p: Specifies whether or not the language is preferred by the person for the associated method of expression.
"Indicates whether or not the Patient prefers this language (over other languages he masters up a certain level)." - HL7 FHIR, Patient.communication.preferred.
A language for which the Person has some level of proficiency for written or spoken communication.
"The patient's primary language. HL7 recommends using ISO table 639" - HL7 Version 2.8, PID-15.
"The next of kin/associated party's primary speaking language." - HL7 Version 2.8, NK1-20.

"The ISO-639-1 alpha 2 code in lower case for the language, optionally followed by a hyphen and the ISO-3166-1 alpha 2 code for the region in upper case. E.g. "en" for English, or "en-US" for American English versus "en-EN" for England English." - HL7 FHIR, Patient.communication.language.
See LanguageAbilityMode Value Set definition for values.
The means by which the person is capable of communicating in the language. Examples of method of expression would be written and spoken.
"A value representing the level of proficiency in a language." - HL7 V3.
